## Promontory

Sunday and Monday had seen significant snow melts and so the hills were quite patchy. The deepest snow were the drifts in the path, and it seemed the higher we went the less snow there was - presumably having been blown away.



![Climbing up Rinnes, looking back at Meikle conval](IMG_2953.jpeg)



What the top lacked in snow, it made up for it in ice, with some rocks being particularly lethal. However, we made it in reasonable time, with a small flurry of snow to greet us. The wind wasn‚Äôt too bad, so we setup on the top by the trig.



![Skating to the trig](IMG_2956.jpeg)

![Top of Ben Rinnes](IMG_2959.jpeg)



Fraser setup on 20m and I tried 2m FM. Ben Rinnes benefits from reaching the Moray coast and back towards Aberdeen on VHF, and often there‚Äôs decent activity from the locals along the coast. However, it was pretty quiet, so I took over from Fraser on HF to qualify the summit before we were too cold.
